divs: sighting detailswe were relaxing after dinner on the boats at the lake with 10-15 friends when someone asked what the orange light was just below the moon. as we looked at the orange light it got brighter and brighter. we were looking east and the object was moving from the south to the north just below the moon at around 10:00 pm. as the object got closer you could see the red and orange get larger. (appeared to be flames from the front of the object) at it's closest point it came to us, it looked like a light bulb through binoculars. in perspective for that night it was approx. 1\10th the size of the moon. appeared to be well below 5,000 ft. and no sound. before reaching the north horizon it faded away. it crossed the night sky in approx. 3-4 minutes and very noticeable.
Summary: Orange fireball shaped like a light bulb flaming, moving from south to north.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Greenfield
This sighting has been favorited 1 time.
